Mishima, Lucrezia and their two teenage children, Marilyn and Vincent, welcome societyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most forlorn outcasts to their shop of horrors. The company thrives on sadness and despair until the birth of Alan, a bundle of joy who turns the gloomy world of this black comedy inside out. 

Trivia:
Patrice Leconte, an icon of French cinema, has over 40 films to his name (Les BronzÃƒÂ©s, The HairdresserÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Husband, Monsieur Hire).
